project_abstract.cdata: Bank financing is sought for two components of this enormous program: Sao Paulo Water Supply and Pollution Control Project. The first is the extension during 1971-1974, by the retail water authority, of its distribution system to enable two million city dwellers to have piped water from the greatly expanded bulk supply expected to be available in the next few years, and to improve service in overloaded sections of the network; the estimated cost is US$59.8 million, of which the Bank loan will finance US$22 million. The second component is the construction during 1971-1974 of sewage interceptors, pumping plants and the reconstruction of a major sewage treatment works by the new metropolitan sewerage authority; the estimated cost is US$81.5 million, of which the Bank loan will finance US$15 million.
